member.name: T:FarPoint.Win.ClipboardChangeNotifier
member.summary: Provides a way to receive notifications of changes to the content of the Clipboard using the Windows API.
member.remarks: To be a part of the change notification you need to register a window in the Clipboard Viewer Chain. This provides notification messages to the window whenever the Clipboard changes, and also messages associated with managing the chain. This class manages the detail of keeping the chain intact and ensuring that the application is removed from the chain at the right point.

member.summary: The next handle in the Clipboard viewer chain when the Clipboard notification is installed, otherwise .

member.summary: Whether this class has been disposed or not.

member.summary: Window for which Clipboard change notification was installed.

member.summary: Notifies of a change to the clipboard's content.

member.summary: Provides default WndProc processing and responds to Clipboard change notifications.

member.summary: Responds to Window Handle change events and uninstalls the Clipboard change notification if it is installed.

member.summary: Installs Clipboard change notification. The AssignHandle method of this class must have been called first.

member.summary: Uninstalls Clipboard change notification.

member.summary:
Check if the specified resource exists in the specified assembly. If the specified assembly is null, check if the file specified by
resourcePath exists.
member.param: The assembly in which we check the specified resource.
member.returns: true if the specified resource exists, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FarPoint.Win.DPISupporting.DPIUtils.GetScaleResourcePaths(System.String,System.Single[])
member.summary: Get the path of scale versions from original path (1x version) of a specified resource. Note: The rule to form the path of scale version from original path (1x version) of a specified resource is: Add the ".(scaleFactor)x" to right before the "." that start the file extension. For example: 1.5x version of D:\abc.png is D:\abc.1.5x.png.
member.param: The original path (1x version) of specifed resource.
The scale factors of scale versions.
member.returns: String array of the path of scale versions of a specifed resource.

member.param: The assembly that contain the specified resource. If the assembly is null, that mean the specified resource is file.
The original path (1x version) of specifed resource.
The scale factors of the request scale versions.

The scale factor of the result Bitmap.
The scale factors of the specified scale versions of the Bitmap resource that would be used to create the result Bitmap.

member.name: T:FarPoint.Win.DPISupporting.MultiScalingBitmapManager
member.summary: Represents the manager that support getting multiscaling versions of Bitmap from resources or provided multiresolution versions of a Bitmap. All the Bitmap getting from this manager are not cached in the manager. So we must dispose the getting Bitmap when we don't need to use that Bitmap. The Bitmap may hold the Bitmaps loading from the resources of the clone versions of the provided multiresolution versions of a Bitmap. So the manager need to be disposed when we don't need to use the manager.

member.name: M:FarPoint.Win.DPISupporting.MultiScalingBitmapManager.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the object. The manager would create the getting request Bitmap by scaling from the existing supporting DPI scaling versions of the Bitmap.
member.param: The original path (1x version) of specifed Image resource in the filesystem.
Indicates if we should preload the existing supporting DPI scaling versions of the Bitmap into the manager.

member.summary: Provides no searching based on character key input; ignores character key input

member.name: F:FarPoint.Win.AutoSearch.SingleCharacter
member.summary: Searches the list items by first character based on a single character key input and if there is a match, scrolls to the first item that matches it

member.name: F:FarPoint.Win.AutoSearch.MultipleCharacter
member.summary: Searches the list items by any number of characters based on the character key input and if there is a match, scrolls to the first item that matches it

member.name: F:FarPoint.Win.AutoSearch.SingleGreaterThan
member.summary: Searches the list items by first character based on a single character key input and if there is a match, scrolls to the first item that matches it and if not, moves to the next item in the list whose first character is greater than this character

member.name: T:FarPoint.Win.PopupWindowHelper
member.summary: A class to assist in creating popup windows like combo box drop-downs and menus. This class includes functionality to keep the title bar of the popup owner form active while the popup is displayed, and to automatically cancel the popup whenever the user clicks outside the popup window or shifts focus to another application.

member.summary: Raised when the popup form is closed.

member.name: E:FarPoint.Win.PopupWindowHelper.PopupCancel
member.summary: Raised when the Popup Window is about to be cancelled. The property can be set to true to prevent the form from being cancelled.

member.param: Main form which owns the popup
Window to show as a popup
Location relative to the screen to show the popup at.

member.summary: Subclasses the owning form's existing Window Procedure to enables the title bar to remain active when a popup is show, and to detect if the user clicks onto another application whilst the popup is visible.

member.summary: A Message Loop filter which detects mouse events while the popup form is shown and notifies the owning class when a mouse click outside the popup occurs.

member.summary: Raised when the Popup Window is about to be cancelled. The property can be set to true to prevent the form from being cancelled.

The host control which receives message to be filtered

member.summary: Gets or sets the popup form which is being displayed.

member.name: M:FarPoint.Win.PopupWindowHelperMessageFilter.PreFilterMessage(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Checks the message loop for mouse messages while the popup window is displayed. If one is detected the position is checked to see if it is outside the form, and the owner is notified if so.
member.param: Windows Message about to be processed by the message loop
member.returns: true to filter the message, false otherwise. This implementation always returns false.

member.summary: Sets the search pattern. Note: This is not a regular expression pattern.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.StringSearch.Greedy
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the regular expression should do a greedy search. A non-Greedy search on the string "FarPoint Technologies" with the pattern "F*o" would return "FarPo". A Greedy search of the same string would return "FarPoint Techno".

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.StringSearch.RegularExpressionPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the regular expression pattern to use for the search.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.StringSearch.MatchExact
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the match must be exact. An exact match is a string that is delimited at the beginning and end by either whitespace or end of line. Note: This property does not have any affect on the search pattern if the pattern was set using the RegularExpressionPattern property.

member.summary: Gets the length of the matched substring

member.summary: Gets the matched substring

member.summary: Searches the value string, starting at a specified index, for a character sequence that matches the provided pattern.

members.member:
DrawTabs - Compute the tab layout and paint the tabs The tab layout is computed going left-to-right and then the tabs are painted right-to-left to take care of painting issues with the overlapped tabs.
Draws the tabs after computing the tab layout. PaintEventArgs object containing the event data

member.name: F:FarPoint.Win.Touch.ManipulationDelta.Expansion
member.summary: The change in distance between touch contacts, as DIPs. For example, if the distance between two contacts changes from 100 DIPs to 200 DIPs during a manipulation, the value of Expansion would be 100.0.

member.name: T:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties
member.summary: Provides extended properties for a object.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.ContactRect
member.summary: Gets the rectangle boundary of the contact area (typically from touch input).
member.value: The bounding rectangle of the contact area, using client window coordinates in device-independent pixels (DIPs).

remarks.para: contains the bounding rectangle of the contact area as interpreted by the system. Under some circumstances, such as input prediction, this data can be modified by the system to compensate for hardware latency or message latency due to inherent delays in sensing and processing the pointer location on the digitizer.
See for more information on raw input data.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.ContactRectRaw
member.summary: Gets the rectangle boundary of the raw input (typically from touch input).
member.value: The bounding rectangle of the raw input, in device-independent pixels (DIPs)

remarks.para: contains the bounding rectangle of the raw input as reported by the input device. Under some circumstances, such as input prediction, this data can be modified by the system to compensate for hardware latency or message latency due to inherent delays in sensing and processing the pointer location on the digitizer.
See for more information on handling modified input data.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.IsBarrelButtonPressed
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the barrel button of the pen or stylus device is pressed.
member.value: if the barrel button is pressed; otherwise, .

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.IsCanceled
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the input was canceled by the pointer device.
member.value: if the input was canceled; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Pointer input can be canceled for various reasons, including:

list.item: Input arbitration (such as pen or stylus proximity overriding touch input)

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.IsEraser
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the input is from a digitizer eraser.
member.value: if the input is from a digitizer eraser; otherwise, .

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.IsInRange
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the physical entity (finger or pen) is in range of the digitizer.
member.value: if in range; otherwise, .

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.IsInverted
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the digitizer pen is inverted.
member.value: if inverted; otherwise, .

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.IsPrimary
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the input is from the primary pointer when multiple pointers are registered.
member.value: if the input is from the pointer designated as primary; otherwise, .
member.remarks: A primary pointer can perform actions that are not available to other pointers. For example, the primary pointer can send a WM_POINTERACTIVATE message when it makes contact with a window.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.Orientation
member.summary: Gets the counter-clockwise angle of rotation around the major axis of the pointer device (the z-axis, perpendicular to the surface of the digitizer). A value of 0.0 degrees indicates the device is oriented towards the top of the digitizer.
member.value: A value between 0.0 and 359.0 in degrees of rotation. The default value is 0.0.
member.remarks: Orientation is also referred to as azimuth.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.Pressure
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the force that the pointer device (typically a pen or stylus) exerts on the surface of the digitizer.
member.value: A value from 0 to 1.0. The default value is 0.5.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.TouchConfidence
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pointer device rejected the touch contact.
member.value: if the touch contact was accepted; otherwise, .

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.Twist
member.summary: Gets the clockwise rotation in degrees of a pen device around its own major axis (such as when the user spins the pen in their fingers).
member.value: A value between 0.0 and 359.0 in degrees of rotation. The default value is 0.0.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.XTilt
member.summary: Gets the plane angle between the Y-Z plane and the plane that contains the y-axis and the axis of the input device (typically a pen or stylus).
member.value: The value is 0.0 when the finger or pen is perpendicular to the digitizer surface, between 0.0 and 179.0 when tilted to the right of perpendicular, and between 0.0 and -179.0 when tilted to the left of perpendicular. The default value is 0.0.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Win.Touch.PointerPointProperties.YTilt
member.summary: Gets the plane angle between the X-Z plane and the plane that contains the x-axis and the axis of the input device (typically a pen or stylus).
member.value: The value is 0.0 when the finger or pen is perpendicular to the digitizer surface, between 0.0 and -179.0 when tilted towards the user, and between 0.0 and 179.0 when tilted away from the user. The default value is 0.0.

member.summary: Enumerates pointer device types.

remarks.note: does not support the mouse pointer type, only pen or touch can raise pointer events.

member.summary: Specifies a touch-enabled device

member.summary: Parses date format string to determine the order of the day-month-year (and which are included).
member.returns: false if no date parts were found; otherwise true

member.name: M:FarPoint.Win.SuperEdit.GeneralFormatter.GetTimePartOrdering(FarPoint.Win.SuperEdit.GeneralFormatter.FpseDecodeParameters,System.String)
member.summary: Parses time format string to determine the order of the hour-min-secs-am/pm (and which are included).

member.name: M:FarPoint.Win.SuperEdit.GeneralFormatter.ConvertDateTimePartsToValue(FarPoint.Win.SuperEdit.GeneralFormatter.FpseDecodeParameters,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object@)
member.summary: Given the date and time parts, convert to date and time values.
member.returns:
bit flag about the results of the conversion: fpseDecodeDateResultsMask 0x03 (bits 0 and 1) FPSE_DECODE_NODATE 0x00 // no date specified in string fpseDecodeInvalidDate 0x01 // date specified but invalid fpseDecodeValidDate 0x02 // specified and valid
fpseDecodeTimeResultsMask 0x0C (bits 3 and 4) FPSE_DECODE_NOTIME 0x00 // no time specified in string fpseDecodeInvalidTime 0x04 // time specified but invalid fpseDecodeValidTime 0x08 // specified and valid

member.name: M:FarPoint.Win.SuperEdit.GeneralFormatter.ConvertDatePartsToValue(FarPoint.Win.SuperEdit.GeneralFormatter.FpseDecodeParameters,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Given the date parts, convert to a date value.
member.returns: true if the date parts could be converted to a date value; false otherwise

member.name: M:FarPoint.Win.SuperEdit.GeneralFormatter.ConvertTimePartsToValue(FarPoint.Win.SuperEdit.GeneralFormatter.FpseDecodeParameters,System.TimeSpan@)
member.summary: Given the time parts, convert to a time value.
member.returns: true if the time parts could be converted to a time value; false otherwise

member.name: M:FarPoint.Win.SuperEdit.IManageFmtInput.GetFormatStringAtPos(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the format string for the field at the specified position in the given text.
member.remarks: Example: Format String: "d/mm/yy", currText: "25/12/02" position: 3. This method will return "mm". Returns "" if bad position. If at a literal position, then the char at that position, preceded with a backslash, is returned ("\c" where 'c' is the actual char).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Licenses.WinFormLicenseProvider
member.summary: Represents a license provider of a Windows Forms PowerTools component.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Common.GcNetFxLicenseProvider`1.VerifyDesignTimeEnvironment
member.summary: Verify the environment to get whether the component is in design-time.
member.returns: true if it is in design-time; otherwise false.
member.remarks: In DesignTime, because of IDE bugs, some component are not created with DesigntimeLicenseContext. For example, when drag a control from Win Forms DataSource tool window, or use a web control in a ASP.NET Template. This may cause the control do run-time license validation and found that there is no license. To resolve this problem, we will check the environment and decide whether to do design-time license validation again.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Common.Resources.LicenseDialogKind.Info
member.summary: Info dialog. It is shown for a trial license.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Common.Resources.LicenseDialogKind.Warning
member.summary: Warning dialog. It is shown for a trial license which is expired.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Common.Resources.LicenseDialogKind.Error
member.summary: Error dialog. It is shown for an invalid license or other errors.
